title: Ticket #1088: NeverCreateJobSandbox is wonky in Condor-C
description:
NeverCreateJobSandbox introduces a subtle Condor-C issue. Basically, the NeverCreateJobSandbox attribute gets set at submit time and then Condor-C copies this attribute into the remote job ad. The value of NeverCreateJobSandbox may be inconsistent with the value of remote_ShouldTransferFiles used in the Condor-C submission.

This is not a terrible bug, because I don't think it hits in the normal Condor-C usage case where the original job and the remote job both use file transfer. (But sorry I didn't think of this when we discussed this method of doing things, Will!)

How to reproduce: 

universe = grid
grid_resource = condor FULL_HOSTNAME COLLECTOR_HOST
executable = /bin/date
output = simple.out
error = simple.err
log = simple.log
remote_universe = vanilla
+remote_requirements = True
+remote_requirements = True
+remote_ShouldTransferFiles = "YES"
+remote_WhenToTransferOutput = "ON_EXIT"

queue

The starter fails with the following message: 

FileTransfer: DownloadFiles called on server side

This illustrates two problems:

  1. The starter and the shadow do not use the same logic to determine whether file transfer should happen. (Seems like this should be shared code in a static method of the file transfer object.) Specifically, JICShadow::initFileTransfer does not pay attention to NeverCreateJobSandbox. Either or both of the following should be done: A) the starter should use the same logic as the shadow to decide whether to do file transfer B) the shadow should set ShouldTransferFiles="NO" if it is not consistent with NeverCreateJobSandbox.

  2. Condor-C should be smart about NeverCreateJobSandbox when submitting the remote job (same logic as condor_submit). Or this logic should be moved into the schedd.
remarks:
2010-Nov-23 11:25:29 by bbockelm:
Ouch - just got hit by this one.

I would note that the "how to reproduce" is basically the same job as the example in the manual.

If this can't be fixed quickly, can we change the manual so the example is functional?

2010-Nov-24 17:59:14 by danb:
The solution I am trying is to get rid of NeverCreateJobSandbox. In the file transfer object, rather than always creating the spool directory, it will only created when it is needed. The schedd still creates/chowns the sandbox for spooled jobs and for jobs that specify JobRequiresSandbox. For backward compatibility, it also does this for all parallel universe jobs.
